com.whirvis.jraknet

Class Packet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.Packet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RakNetPacket

    public class Packet
extends java.lang.Object
    A generic packet that has the ability to read and write data to and from a source buffer.
    Since:
    JRakNet v1.0.0
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Packet()
      Creates an empty packet.
      Packet(byte[] data)
      Creates a packet from an existing byte[]
      Packet(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
      Creates a packet using the specified ByteBuf
      Packet(io.netty.channel.socket.DatagramPacket datagram)
      Creates packet from an existing DatagramPacket.
      Packet(Packet packet)
      Creates a packet from an existing packet's buffer.

      Flips the packet.

      Writes an IPv4 address to the packet.

      Writes an IPv4/IPv6 address to the packet.
      Packet writeAddress(java.lang.String host, int port)
      Writes an IPv4 address to the packet (IPv6 is not yet supported).

      Writes a boolean to the packet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Packet

        public Packet(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a packet using the specified ByteBuf
        Parameters:
        buffer - the ByteBuf to read from and write to, a null value will have a new buffer be used instead.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the buffer is an EmptyByteBuf.

      • Packet

        public Packet(io.netty.channel.socket.DatagramPacket datagram)
        Creates packet from an existing DatagramPacket.
        Parameters:
        datagram - the DatagramPacket to read from.

      • Packet

        public Packet(byte[] data)
        Creates a packet from an existing byte[]
        Parameters:
        data - the byte[] to read from.

      • Packet

        public Packet(Packet packet)
        Creates a packet from an existing packet's buffer.
        Parameters:
        packet - the packet whose buffer to copy and then read from and write to.

      • Packet

        public Packet()
        Creates an empty packet.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public final Packet read(byte[] dest)
                  throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Reads data into the specified byte[].
        Parameters:
        dest - the byte[] to read the data into.
        Returns:
        the packet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there are less readable bytes than the length of dest.

                  throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

        Parameters:
        length - the amount of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        the read bytes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there are less readable bytes than the specified length.

        public final byte readByte()
                    throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Reads a byte.
        Returns:
        a byte.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there are less than 1 readable byte left in the packet.

      • readBoolean

        public final boolean readBoolean()
                          throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Reads a boolean.
        Returns:
        true if the byte read is anything higher than 0, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there are less than 1 readable byte left in the packet.

      • readString

        public final java.lang.String readString()
                                  throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Reads a UTF-8 string with its length prefixed by an unsigned short.
        Returns:
        a string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there are less than 2 readable bytes left in the packet to read the length of the string, or if there are less readable bytes than are specified by the length.

      • readStringLE

        public final java.lang.String readStringLE()
                                    throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Reads a UTF-8 string with its length prefixed by a unsigned little -endian short.
        Returns:
        a string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there are less than 2 readable bytes left in the packet to read the length of the string, or if there are less readable bytes than are specified by the length.

      • readAddress

        public final java.net.InetSocketAddress readAddress()
                                             throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                                    java.net.UnknownHostException
        Reads an IPv4/IPv6 address.
        Returns:
        an IPv4/IPv6 address.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there are less than 8 readable bytes left in the packet when it is an IPv4 address or 30 when it is an IPv6 address.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the host could be found, a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address, or the address version is an unknown version.

      • readUUID

        public final java.util.UUID readUUID()
                              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Reads a UUID.
        Returns:
        a UUID.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if there are less than 16 readable bytes left in the packet.

        Returns:

        public final Packet writeString(java.lang.String s)
                         throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Writes a UTF-8 string prefixed by an unsigned short to the packet.
        Parameters:
        s - the string.
        Returns:
        the packet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if s is null.

      • writeStringLE

        public final Packet writeStringLE(java.lang.String s)
                           throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Writes a UTF-8 string prefixed by a little-endian unsigned short to the packet.
        Parameters:
        s - the string.
        Returns:
        the packet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if s is null.

      • writeAddress

        public final Packet writeAddress(java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                 java.net.UnknownHostException
        Writes an IPv4/IPv6 address to the packet.
        Parameters:
        address - the address.
        Returns:
        the packet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the address or IP address are null.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the host could be found, if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address, or the length of the address is not either 4 or 16 bytes.

      • writeAddress

        public final Packet writeAddress(java.net.InetAddress host,
                                 int port)
                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.net.UnknownHostException
        Writes an IPv4 address to the packet.
        Parameters:
        host - the IP address.
        port - the port.
        Returns:
        the packet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the host is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is not in between 0-65535.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the host could not be found, or if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address.

      • writeAddress

        public final Packet writeAddress(java.lang.String host,
                                 int port)
                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.net.UnknownHostException
        Writes an IPv4 address to the packet (IPv6 is not yet supported).
        Parameters:
        host - the IP address.
        port - the port.
        Returns:
        the packet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the host is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is not in between 0-65535.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the host could not be found, or if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address.

      • array

        public byte[] array()
        Returns the packet as a byte[].
        Returns:
        the packet as a byte[], null if the buffer being used within the packet is a direct buffer.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the size of the packet in bytes.

        This is to be used only for packets that are being written to. To get the amount of bytes that are still readable, use the remaining() method.

        Returns:
        the size of the packet in bytes.

      • buffer

        public io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer()
        Returns the packet buffer.
        Returns:
        the packet buffer.

      • copy

        public io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf copy()
        Returns a copy of the packet buffer.
        Returns:
        a copy of the packet buffer.

      • getInputStream

        public final PacketDataInputStream getInputStream()
        Returns the packet's InputStream
        Returns:
        the packet's InputStream.

      • getOutputStream

        public final PacketDataOutputStream getOutputStream()
        Returns the packet's OutputStream.
        Returns:
        the packet's OutputStream.

      • remaining

        public int remaining()
        Returns how many readable bytes are left in the packet's buffer.

        This is to only be used for packets that are being read from. To get the amount of bytes that have been written to the packet, use the size() method.

        Returns:
        how many readable bytes are left in the packet's buffer.

      • setBuffer

        public final Packet setBuffer(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
        Updates the buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer to read from and write to, a null value will have a new buffer be used instead.
        Returns:
        the packet.

        Parameters:
        datagram - the DatagramPacket whose buffer to read from and write to.
        Returns:
        the packet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the datagram packet is null.
